attributes.action: Urge Ofsted to rethink policy of asking Muslim children about wearing a Hijab
attributes.background: Amanda Spielman, the head of Ofsted, said the move was to tackle situations in which wearing a hijab “could be interpreted as sexualisation” of girls as young as four or five. Wearing Hijab is a cultural matter as much as one of 'modesty'. In many societies it's also a norm dress for Christians.
attributes.additional_details: The press has picked up on this today (18 November). This matter challenges ethnic minority rights to dress as our cultures allow for, our history, and window washing it as a 'muslim' matter. The majority of white school children are not asked by Ofsted about perming, curling, dying their hair, wearing wigs or make up. What is the difference? Allow us to parent our children appropriately until they are of age.

attributes.action: Legally recognise non-binary gender identities
attributes.background:
Multiple countries legally recognize non-binary or third gender classifications. They are available to people with gender identities that differ from their sex assigned at birth. It’s important we support our lgbt community.

Sourced from wikipedia
attributes.additional_details:
Some non-western societies have long recognized transgender and/or non-binary people as a third gender, though this may not (or may only recently)[4] include formal legal recognition

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legal_recognition_of_non-binary_gender

attributes.action: Change the law for unmarried couples concerning benefits when a partner dies.
attributes.background: My partner of 26 years recently died. Although we were treated as a married couple for benefits whilst he was alive as soon as he died our time together did not count any more. I couldn't register his death and am not entitled to any of the benefits widows get.
attributes.additional_details: It is not right  that you are classed as a couple in life but single after a death. The law needs to be changed so that couples who have been together for a certain number of years, especially when claiming benefits together, can be treated the same as a married couple. My grief has been worsened by constantly being told if you don't have the piece of paper you can't register his death or claim any help, as a widow/widower could, for example help with funeral costs.

attributes.action: Ban cigarette smoking in public areas.
attributes.background: Most people will agree that inhaling the poison in cigarettes should be optional. Yet we still have to breathe it in when simply walking in public. If you don't want to breathe in the health damaging smoke of passers by then sign this petition to get a government ban on smoking in public spaces.
attributes.additional_details: Smoking and passive smoking has serious health risks. We should all be allowed to choose whether we want to be subjected to those risks.

attributes.action: Place a permanent ban on the UK production and import of plastic drinking straws
attributes.background: Plastic pollution is a global issue, with plastic now being found in all oceans. Wasteful single-use items such as drinking straws are at the forefront of the problem. Every plastic straw ever made still exists in some form and they are consistently in the top ten of items found during beach cleans.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastic straws are a big part of the global problem of unnecessary items ending up in the ocean, harming wildlife and entering the food chain. Eco friendly alternatives are available and there's no excuse for not using them.

http://www.plasticpollutioncoalition.org/pft/2017/1/3/the-problem-of-plastic-straws-and-how-each-of-us-can-make-a-difference

This petition demands that the British Government put planet before profit and permanently ban the UK production and import of plastic straws.

attributes.action: Make the 16/30 free hours worth of childcare available to children from 6 months
attributes.background: The government offers 16 hours worth of free childcare when your child is two and either 15/30 free hours for children aged 3-4, what about free childcare for children younger than this for all the parents that want to work but will struggle to do so with the current fees for childcare?
attributes.additional_details: The current system is out dated and ridiculous.  There are plenty of families/single parents that want to go out to work when their child is a few months old but are unable to do so because of the crippling prices of childcare fees.  For this reason the government needs to start the free childcare entitlement age to 6+ months, so that every family that wants to go out and work can do so without working to just cover nursery fees.

attributes.action:
Impose regulations on the use of models whose body mass
index is below 18.5.
attributes.background:
This petition is to introduce a law prohibiting the use of models whose BMI is below 18.5 (the lowest healthy BMI considered by medical professionals). 
This requirement would necessitate a medical certificate from a
physician, to ensure the model is in good health.
attributes.additional_details:
This applies to models used in advertising, media, fashion shows,
catwalk shows and for any other other promotional purposes, and
applies to both male and female models.

The purpose of this requirement is to prohibit the normalisation of
low body weights and the glamorisation of an unhealthy body image.
Instead, using models with a healthy BMI of 18.5 or above would
re-calibrate the public perception of a ‘normal’ body shape and weight.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of rabbits in pet shops & garden centres.
attributes.background: Rabbits are the 3rd most popular pet in the UK, yet the most neglected and abandoned. Pet shops and garden centres do not properly educate people on the appropriate care of rabbits and sell them as cheap, easy short-lived pets who live in small cages, which is very incorrect. Rabbits deserve better.
attributes.additional_details: 4 out of 5 rabbits bought as pets near Easter are abandoned or die within a year. (source: The Metro). Rabbits are the most abused domestic pet in England and Wales, with 35,000 abandoned every year. Also 70% of rescued rabbits had been kept hutched 24 hours a day. The RSPCA states that people bought rabbits but then quickly lost interest. On avg, the rabbits it came across had been dumped after just three months. (souce: RSPCA) If they are not in shops, they will not be impulse buys.

attributes.action: Abolish universal credit return to old system!
attributes.background: New universal credit replaces JSA, income support, ESA, Housing benefit, Tax credits and working tax credits. Government says universal credit will make work pay. This is rubbish. Universal credit is about cutting the social security bill meaning millions will be worse off.
attributes.additional_details: Once fully implemented will mean easier sanctioning forcing people to live on nothing. Housing subsidy will be time limited forcing more to be homeless. Support for childcare will be drastically cut. Disability element's cut or abolished altogether. Some rates are much lower than current benefit rates. Government has so far wasted hundreds of millions. They will save billions taking from the needy and most vulnerable in our society. This is a war against the poor. Whilst they prop up the rich!

attributes.action: Make domestic abusers sign a register
attributes.background: Domestic abuse will affect 1 in 4 women and 1 in 6 men in their lifetime and leads to, on average, two women being murdered each week and 30 men per year. By getting domestic abusers to sign a register, this could at least warn people before they decide to continue in a relationship with someone.

attributes.action: Provide full or part government funding for all UK air ambulance services
attributes.background: Air ambulances across the UK are saving thousands of lies every year and all are completely reliant on charity contributions.  This is an unacceptable and unreliable state to be in and government funding should be provided

attributes.action: The government should not be transferring all EU Regulations into British law.
attributes.background:
All EU law is bad law.  We do not want one single word of it in British law. The government is transferring 170,000 pages of EU Regulations and Directives into English law. 
It is all just EU Red Tape and it is strangling British industry. 
Say no to the Acquis Communautaire.

attributes.action: To not spend £50m of public money on a memorial to the Holocaust
attributes.background:
Why are we spending £50m of public money on a memorial to the Holocaust? Great Britain didn't carry out this atrocity but spent years fighting at war because of it. 
Surely this is tribute enough? 
Spend our money on more pressing matters at home , e.g.  NHS etc.

attributes.action: Stop forced adoption and make it illegal.
attributes.background: Let’s get the Government to listen to the people. We need to stop forced adoption and make it illegal. Only parents should be able to consent to their children being adopted.
attributes.additional_details: There’s 25,000 plus children who are forcibly adopted in the U.K. each year by the secret family courts. These courts are not open to the public unlike criminal courts.  Parents who are party to proceedings are forbidden to talk to anyone about what happens in court. They’re silenced with a gagging order which means if they talk they face 10 years in prison, but it’s time the world knows what is going on in our family courts. Parents have already got the life sentence - isn’t that enough?

attributes.action: Make FCO Consular Services statutory, defined and guaranteed
attributes.background: FCO Consular Service is subject to abuse and discrimination. British nationals abroad cannot rely upon the published FCO Customer Charter, as it has an enormous caveat; all help is discretionary, not statutory. British nationals currently have no recourse against the FCO for failing to help them.
attributes.additional_details: Cases prove that one British national will receive consular service while another does not for the exact same needs. The Gillian Gibbons Sudan case proved that the FCO will intervene significantly more the less important the country. Brexit especially requires that the FCO publish a charter that they will honour for each and every British citizen abroad irrespective of the country involved. Also that the FCO is more proactive in cases of civil and human rights abuse.

attributes.action: All residents of the United Kingdom to be issued with a Biometric Identity Card.
attributes.background: The introduction of Biometric Identity Cards would reduce time and costs to Government agencies in checking legal residents and citizens’ status, make ID checks by Police, Immigration and other official bodies impartial and puts every entitled resident/citizen on a level playing field.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently several ID card schemes in the UK including; Proof of age card, 'Gov.UK Verify', (described as an 'Online ID card), Passports and driving licenses, but not everyone has one and all of these are voluntary and not all are Biometric.
A National Biometric ID card would streamline the system, reduce costs and protect the law abiding legal residents and citizens in the UK whilst at the same time making life more difficult for those that choose to defraud or harm us.

attributes.action: Make battery farming of livestock illegal and only allow free range farming
attributes.background: There are hundreds of battery farms in the UK that force animals such as Chickens to live in cramped, inhumane conditions where they can barely move. This causes a huge amount of suffering to animals who are not allowed to live in their natural environment.

attributes.action: Mental Health Education and coping strategies to be taught in schools
attributes.background: Let's look to prevention rather than cure and enable young people with awareness skills and coping strategies taught in schools so as to enable them to not feel so helpless when faced with depression, anxiety and the like further in life.

attributes.action: For all schools in England to teach students the God Save The Queen.
attributes.background: For the British government to make it mandatory for all schools in England to teach all their students God Save The Queen.

attributes.action: Create a Devolved English Parliament
attributes.background: Scotland has the Scottish Parliament, Wales has the Welsh Assembly (soon to be Parliament) and Northern Ireland has the Northern Ireland Assembly. As the most populous country within the United Kingdom, England should also have a parliament to end the West Lothian Question.
attributes.additional_details: For too long England has had Scottish, Welsh, and Northern Irish MPs vote on matters that only affect England. It is time to have a devolved parliament to bring fairness and democracy to the region.

attributes.action: Rebuild the “Hereford, Hay and Brecon” and “Mid-Wales” railways
attributes.background: The Beeching cuts of the 1960s closed a significant number of lines in the Marches and mid-Wales, the return of which would boost the economy and vitality of the area. There would also be a potential reduction in road traffic and therefore of carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Force developers to complete housing sites enabling timely adoption
attributes.background: Introduce legislation giving local authorities comprehensive powers enabling them to force Housing Developers to complete new developments, with particular reference to road surfacing and completion of landscaping and adoption of shared open spaces, before they are able to start new projects.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a national problem affecting all areas, which local authorities clearly do not have the necessary powers to resolve.

Discussion with our own County Council leader reveals that they have very limited powers to force developers to complete sites enabling their adoption in a timely manner.

attributes.action: Increase the maximum prison sentence for animal cruelty to 10 years.
attributes.background: Sadly humans are not treated the same as other animals. This is completely wrong and this must be changed. So changing the prison sentence to 10 years will start to give all animals the rights they need.
attributes.additional_details: Right now the maximum prison sentence for animal cruelty is 6 months. There are plans to increase it to 5 years. This doesn’t go far enough, it needs to be 10 years.

attributes.action: The new sex education curriculum should explain what constitutes sexual assault
attributes.background: Social media phenomenon #MeToo revealed the under-reported prevalence of sexual assault. The new Relationships & Sex Education curriculum, due 2019, must explain to all genders exactly what constitutes sexual assault and harassment; both to prevent it happening and encourage victims to come forward.
attributes.additional_details:
Education secretary Justine Greening's much-needed, widely-applauded new curriculum covers consent, but doesn't specifically explain the arguably grey areas of sexual assault and harassment. Many victims of "minor" assaults don't understand that what they've experienced is a crime; or feel it's too common to be worth reporting. To reduce sexual assault and support the victims, we must first teach young people exactly what it is.

http://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN06103
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/blogs-trending-41633857
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/sexual-harassment-poll-yougov-young-people-night-out-a7972991.html

attributes.action: Start dredging rivers regularly in the help of flood prevention.
attributes.background: Cumbria has suffered many bad floods over the last 13 years and it's time something was done. Flood defences only slow down the water but actually clearing the rivers of silt and debris would be more effective. Also allowing farmers to manage rivers flowing through their land.

attributes.action: Remove all Tolls to cross over/under the River Mersey, via Bridges or Tunnels.
attributes.background:
The Mersey Tunnels have been tolled for years
The Mersey Road Bridges are following suit
The NW region  is struggling economically. 
Bring all Mersey crossings back into the National Roads structure, like similar structures in Wales and Scotland. This will develop a real "Northern Powerhouse".

attributes.action: Expedite legislation guaranteeing the right to vote for UK citizens for life.
attributes.background: UK citizens residing outside the UK lose the right to vote in UK elections and referenda after 15 years as an overseas elector. The government had said it would introduce legislation to change this, giving the right to vote for life. That legislation should be introduced within the next 6 months.

attributes.action: Put the university fee down to £6000. Not fair on students too much burden.
attributes.background: Once the students have achieved their target they start working. It's really hard for students to work, study, they pay for traveling, food and accommodation. Once they start work it's not fair on them to pay back loan with interest. If the fee goes down to £6000 it makes it little easier.

attributes.action: Compulsory labelling of recyclability on all products
attributes.background: Many products don't explicitly state whether or not they are recyclable. This creates a lot of confusion and results in recyclable items being put in normal waste bins, which is detrimental to the environment. If non-recyclable items are wrongly disposed of, they can disrupt the recycling process.

attributes.action: Change the law regarding Parental Responsibility
attributes.background: When family member such as grandparent, aunt, uncle etc is bringing up a family member such as grandchild, nephew, niece etc, unless it would harm the child to do so such family members to be automatically granted Parental Responsibility.
attributes.additional_details: Tens of thousands of grandparents bringing up grandchildren in the absence of one or both parents cannot get Parental Responsibility without a tedious, expensive and often contentious court process. This applies even in cirumstances where the mother is deceased, the father shown not to be the biological father by DNA testing and not playing any part in bringing up the child concerned. Unless it would harm child to do so, Grandparents to be automatically given Parental Responsibility.

attributes.action: Prevent President Buhari and all state Governors of Nigeria from entering the UK
attributes.background: Nigerian Government troops have entered SE Nigeria under Python Dance II. It's an act of provocation. The UK Government must act by banning President Buhari and all state governors of Nigeria from entering the UK.

attributes.action: Let councils borrow to build council housing. Lift the government cap.
attributes.background:
Private tenancies are insecure, expensive and many fail to meet basic standards. 
So called "affordable housing" at 80% of market rents is not genuinely affordable. A programme  of council house building will help address the housing crisis, and council housing pays for itself in the long run.
attributes.additional_details:
Government rules severely restrict council's ability to borrow to build desperately needed council housing.
Council housing funding also needs to be raised to a sustainable level.

attributes.action: Train fare increases should be frozen or capped at 1%
attributes.background: As a long suffering commuter I'm sick of paying out substantially increased fares each year with little noticeable improvement to services. Trains constantly break down, are over-crowded, or the issue is with Network Rail (meaning they get massively compensated but pay back very little to us)

attributes.action: Reinstate sailing and windsurfing to A level and GCSE PE
attributes.background: Recently sailing and windsurfing have been taken off the list of sports you can be marked on for GCSE and A level PE. Some people started this course unaware of this change.
attributes.additional_details: Sailing and Windsurfing should be reinstated as you have to be physically fit to compete, you can race and it involves refining technique to do well. The UK is an island which mean there are plenty of places for young people to participate in these activities.

attributes.action: Commission an urgent evaluation of the NHS 111 service.
attributes.background:
Research strongly suggests that:
1) Non-clinicians using computer software to manage calls to NHS111 may compromise patient safety.
2) Computer software used by NHS111 may lead to too many people being referred across to the 999 service with a consequent ambulance call out and attendance at A&E.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS England plan an ‘Integrated Urgent Care Clinical Assessment Service’ by March 2019. Without in-depth evaluation of NHS 111 the new service will offer little improvement to patients.

We want the Government to commission an independent body to evaluate NHS111 including analysis of calls and decision support software. Evidence and methods for such an evaluation are here:
http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0277953614008107 http://bmjopen.bmj.com/content/3/11/e003451.short

attributes.action: The Government make immediate preparations and employ more border personnel
attributes.background: That the Government must not delay any longer and must immediately hire more personnel, for customs and border security and be ready for brexit in March 2019. We were promised contol of our borders yet so far we have not seen evidence that any preparation has been made

attributes.action: Donald Trump should be refused entry to the UK
attributes.background: On account of his support for extremist organisations, and his lack of understanding of the consequences of his rhetoric, Donald Trump is not a fit and proper person to be permitted to enter the UK.

attributes.action: UK citizens should have the right to carry guns for self-defense
attributes.background: Given the current state of affairs in this country, people should be able to defend themselves and their families from terrorist and other criminal entities
attributes.additional_details: Enough is enough the terrorist has weapons why should people in this country live in the fear of being murdered in our own towns. If we are to be expected to live alongside people that want to kill us we should have the right to defend ourselves. Obviously, some kind of background checking system must be put in place if this is to work

attributes.action: Bring the Bayeux Tapestry to Hastings (or Battle).
attributes.background: It's great President Macron has agreed to loan the Bayeux Tapestry to the UK. It should be displayed in Hastings (or Battle), home of the historic battleground. It would also be a huge boost for the area's tourism.

attributes.action: Stop car Insurance Companies from increasing drivers for no fault accident claim
attributes.background: Make applying financial increases to driver insurance premiums who have been involved in an accident with a non-insured driver or in a no fault accident, illegal.
attributes.additional_details:
It is unreasonable and unjust that drivers whom are unfortunate in being involved in a no fault accidents, or those involved in incidents whereby the other driver is not insured; should suffer a financial increase on their own insurance premiums. 

We pay a huge amount of money to the Insurance sector to protect us against incidents where our vehicles are stolen or damaged. At the moment a no fault accident will attract a minimum of a 10.81% load on your premiums, how is this fair or just?

attributes.action: Make prescriptions for epipens free to anaphylaxis sufferers on the NHS
attributes.background: Vital life-saving drugs qualify for free prescriptions on the NHS, such as those that treat diabetes. Anaphylaxis sufferers have to carry an epipen throughout their life. This is undoubtedly a life-saving medication and should qualify to be on the exemption certificate for free prescriptions.

attributes.action: Re-nationalise the train service
attributes.background: Due to the privatisation of the train services, commuters have experienced frequent delays, with poorer service than would be expected of any EU country's services. On top of this, commuters face high fares, which are rising much faster than the rate of inflation.
attributes.additional_details: If we take Berlin and London, we can see a stark contrast in travel card prices there. For example, a day travel card in Berlin (zones ABC - which includes the city and its surrounding area) would cost an adult 7,70€ (£6.78), however, in London a day travel card (in zones 1-6) would cost an adult £11.70. The difference shows that a nationalised system is cheaper.

attributes.action: Let mothers be named on marriage certificates
attributes.background:
Currently marriage certificates only allow the fathers name on them and not mothers.

This petition aims to bring the marriage certificate into the 21st century.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for male toilets to have baby change facilities.
attributes.background: When my husband takes out our daughter and they just have male/female toilets, there are no baby change facilities in the male toilets! This means he either has to change her on the floor, bench or leave her until she gets home. This is not ideal.
attributes.additional_details:
There are so many more involved dads nowadays, diversification of families and opportunity of shared maternity leave. We need to make things more accessible for dads too!

Where changing facility are not in unisex toilets like disabled ones, i propose this be a legal requirement for these to be in both female and male toilets.

attributes.action: Stop shops opening on boxing day
attributes.background: Please give retail workers an extra day off to spend with their families

attributes.action: Allow Tyler the Creator back into the UK
attributes.background:
Tyler, The Creator claims he has been banned from the UK.
The US rapper says he is not allowed to enter the country for "three to five years" because of lyrics he wrote in 2009.
The co-founder of hip-hop collective Odd Future has always attracted controversy.
attributes.additional_details: Freedom of speech is the right to articulate one's opinions and ideas without fear of government retaliation or censorship, or societal sanction. The term freedom of expression is sometimes used synonymously, but includes any act of seeking, receiving and imparting information or ideas, regardless of the medium used. This right has been incorporated into the Human Rights Act in 1998 and is still used today.

attributes.action: Introduce domestic abuse awareness as part of life skills to the curriculum
attributes.background: On 21.01.2018 an innocent child lost her life to domestic abuse.  The term "domestic incident" was used, minimising the severity of domestic abuse, indicating that there is a lack of understanding of the complex cycle.  Without awareness of this crime, how are we able to protect our young people?
attributes.additional_details:
My name is Samantha Billingham and I am a survivor of domestic abuse.

It is easier to stop something happening in the first place than to repair the damage after it has happened and with mandatory awareness, we can do that.  The outcome of talking about domestic abuse will have a positive behaviour enabling our young people to deal effectively with the challenges that domestic abuse brings to life.

Awareness is powerful, it gives people choices, options, knowledge, which could just save a life.

attributes.action: Make not keeping receipts/basic accounts when you hold an LPA a criminal offence
attributes.background: Now, if you're entrusted with a vulnerable persons finances, a Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) it is only suggested that you keep receipts/records/basic accounts to explain any purchases made. It should be a legal requirement to produce this if requested to help safeguard our vulnerable loved ones.
attributes.additional_details: I lost my father, Richard Nelson Scott, on 17/5/16. No one thinks that a family member will steal from their vulnerable, ill loved one but it happened to us. It's happening more now with our ageing population. Some get away with it by having an LPA. By amending current guidelines the LPA holder will have to produce records if a concerned person wants an investigation of financial affairs.

attributes.action: Adopt into UK law all anti-abuse measures of EU Anti-Tax Avoidance Directive.
attributes.background: Tax avoidance is widely accepted to be legal but both immoral and anti-social. As the EU’s anti tax avoidance directive can be universally accepted as a good thing and has not been a factor in public debate concerning the UK’s EU membership, the UK should opt in to the directive and implement fully.

attributes.action: Offer Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe diplomatic protection and secure her release.
attributes.background: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe has been imprisoned unjustly in Iran and her case has been set back by Michael Gove and Boris Johnson’s failure to be clear about her motive for travel. She should be offered diplomatic protection and brought back to the UK, with her child Gabriella, as quickly as possible.
